content.text: I need to check the server handlers first to understand the exact return types, then create the React frontend.

<file path="server/src/handlers/get_counter.ts">
import { db } from '../db';
import { countersTable } from '../db/schema';
import { type Counter } from '../schema';

export const getCounter = async (): Promise<Counter> => {
  try {
    // Get the first counter record
    const result = await db.select()
      .from(countersTable)
      .limit(1)
      .execute();

    // If no counter exists, create one with default values
    if (result.length === 0) {
      const newResult = await db.insert(countersTable)
        .values({
          count: 0
        })
        .returning()
        .execute();

      return newResult[0];
    }

    return result[0];
  } catch (error) {
    console.error('Counter retrieval failed:', error);
    throw error;
  }
};
</file>

<file path="server/src/tests/get_counter.test.ts">
import { afterEach, beforeEach, describe, expect, it } from 'bun:test';
import { resetDB, createDB } from '../helpers';
import { db } from '../db';
import { countersTable } from '../db/schema';
import { getCounter } from '../handlers/get_counter';

describe('getCounter', () => {
  beforeEach(createDB);
  afterEach(resetDB);

  it('should create and return default counter when none exists', async () => {
    const result = await getCounter();

    // Verify default values
    expect(result.count).toEqual(0);
    expect(result.id).toBeDefined();
    expect(result.updated_at).toBeInstanceOf(Date);
    expect(typeof result.id).toBe('number');
    expect(typeof result.count).toBe('number');
  });

  it('should return existing counter when one exists', async () => {
    // Create a counter with specific values
    await db.insert(countersTable)
      .values({
        count: 42
      })
      .execute();

    const result = await getCounter();

    // Should return the existing counter
    expect(result.count).toEqual(42);
    expect(result.id).toBeDefined();
    expect(result.updated_at).toBeInstanceOf(Date);
  });

  it('should save new counter to database when none exists', async () => {
    const result = await getCounter();

    // Verify counter was saved to database
    const counters = await db.select()
      .from(countersTable)
      .execute();

    expect(counters).toHaveLength(1);
    expect(counters[0].id).toEqual(result.id);
    expect(counters[0].count).toEqual(0);
    expect(counters[0].updated_at).toBeInstanceOf(Date);
  });

  it('should return first counter when multiple exist', async () => {
    // Create multiple counters
    await db.insert(countersTable)
      .values([
        { count: 10 },
        { count: 20 }
      ])
      .execute();

    const result = await getCounter();

    // Should return the first counter
    expect(result.count).toEqual(10);
  });
});
</file>

<file path="server/src/handlers/increment_counter.ts">
import { db } from '../db';
import { countersTable } from '../db/schema';
import { type IncrementCounterInput, type Counter } from '../schema';
import { sql } from 'drizzle-orm';

export const incrementCounter = async (input: IncrementCounterInput): Promise<Counter> => {
  try {
    // First, try to get the existing counter (assuming single counter with id=1)
    const existingCounters = await db.select()
      .from(countersTable)
      .limit(1)
      .execute();

    let result;

    if (existingCounters.length === 0) {
      // No counter exists, create one with the increment value
      const insertResult = await db.insert(countersTable)
        .values({
          count: input.increment,
          updated_at: new Date()
        })
        .returning()
        .execute();
      
      result = insertResult[0];
    } else {
      // Counter exists, increment it
      const existingCounter = existingCounters[0];
      const updateResult = await db.update(countersTable)
        .set({
          count: existingCounter.count + input.increment,
          updated_at: new Date()
        })
        .where(sql`id = ${existingCounter.id}`)
        .returning()
        .execute();
      
      result = updateResult[0];
    }

    return {
      id: result.id,
      count: result.count,
      updated_at: result.updated_at
    };
  } catch (error) {
    console.error('Counter increment failed:', error);
    throw error;
  }
};
</file>

<file path="server/src/tests/increment_counter.test.ts">
import { afterEach, beforeEach, describe, expect, it } from 'bun:test';
import { resetDB, createDB } from '../helpers';
import { db } from '../db';
import { countersTable } from '../db/schema';
import { type IncrementCounterInput } from '../schema';
import { incrementCounter } from '../handlers/increment_counter';
import { eq } from 'drizzle-orm';

// Test input with default increment
const defaultInput: IncrementCounterInput = {
  increment: 1
};

// Test input with custom increment
const customInput: IncrementCounterInput = {
  increment: 5
};

describe('incrementCounter', () => {
  beforeEach(createDB);
  afterEach(resetDB);

  it('should create a new counter when none exists', async () => {
    const result = await incrementCounter(defaultInput);

    // Basic field validation
    expect(result.id).toBeDefined();
    expect(result.count).toEqual(1);
    expect(result.updated_at).toBeInstanceOf(Date);
  });

  it('should save counter to database', async () => {
    const result = await incrementCounter(defaultInput);

    // Query using proper drizzle syntax
    const counters = await db.select()
      .from(countersTable)
      .where(eq(countersTable.id, result.id))
      .execute();

    expect(counters).toHaveLength(1);
    expect(counters[0].count).toEqual(1);
    expect(counters[0].updated_at).toBeInstanceOf(Date);
  });

  it('should increment existing counter', async () => {
    // Create initial counter
    const firstResult = await incrementCounter(defaultInput);
    expect(firstResult.count).toEqual(1);

    // Increment it again
    const secondResult = await incrementCounter(defaultInput);
    
    expect(secondResult.id).toEqual(firstResult.id);
    expect(secondResult.count).toEqual(2);
    expect(secondResult.updated_at).toBeInstanceOf(Date);
    expect(secondResult.updated_at > firstResult.updated_at).toBe(true);
  });

  it('should handle custom increment values', async () => {
    const result = await incrementCounter(customInput);
    expect(result.count).toEqual(5);

    // Increment by another custom amount
    const secondResult = await incrementCounter({ increment: 3 });
    expect(secondResult.count).toEqual(8);
    expect(secondResult.id).toEqual(result.id);
  });

  it('should update timestamp on each increment', async () => {
    const firstResult = await incrementCounter(defaultInput);
    
    // Small delay to ensure different timestamps
    await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 10));
    
    const secondResult = await incrementCounter(defaultInput);
    
    expect(secondResult.updated_at > firstResult.updated_at).toBe(true);
  });

  it('should verify database state after multiple increments', async () => {
    // Perform multiple increments
    await incrementCounter({ increment: 2 });
    await incrementCounter({ increment: 3 });
    const finalResult = await incrementCounter({ increment: 1 });

    // Query database directly to verify state
    const counters = await db.select()
      .from(countersTable)
      .execute();

    expect(counters).toHaveLength(1);
    expect(counters[0].count).toEqual(6); // 2 + 3 + 1
    expect(counters[0].id).toEqual(finalResult.id);
  });
});
</file>
